body_html: There are many ops that have fixed input types and those no T attrs. Others have multiple T attrs or a single attr with a different name. Often generalizing ops to handle more than one type is good, but LogicalAnd is pretty clearly a bool thing, so it doesn't make sense in this case.
body_text: There are many ops that have fixed input types and those no T attrs.  Others have multiple T attrs or a single attr with a different name.  Often generalizing ops to handle more than one type is good, but LogicalAnd is pretty clearly a bool thing, so it doesn't make sense in this case.
body: There are many ops that have fixed input types and those no `T` attrs.  Others have multiple `T` attrs or a single attr with a different name.  Often generalizing ops to handle more than one type is good, but `LogicalAnd` is pretty clearly a bool thing, so it doesn't make sense in this case.
